title: What will be the outcome of the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade? - Cointelegraph
summary: The Ethereum Shanghai upgrade is expected to have a significant impact on the DeFi space, with potential innovations in liquid staking derivatives. Justin Bram, co-founder and CEO of Astaria, believes that the upgrade will unlock new possibilities for Ether (ETH) and the crypto and DeFi space as a whole. However, he also has his eye on other layer-2 protocols like Arbitrum, and is cautious about the potential risks and challenges that may arise from the upgrade. The interview provides valuable insights into the current state of DeFi and the future of Ethereum, and is a must-watch for anyone interested in the crypto and blockchain industry.

title: Here Are Three Bullish Metrics for Ethereum Rival Solana (SOL), According to InvestAnswers - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Solana (SOL) is seeing bullish metrics according to InvestAnswers, including 446,000 daily active users, a 7-day moving average of non-vote transactions of nearly 30 million, and the second-highest number of commits since inception. The analyst notes that these metrics indicate a spike in activity and a strong development team. Despite a 2% drop in the past 24 hours, SOL is trading at $20.79.

title: Ethereum Projects Launch MEV Blocker to Minimize Invisible Tax - Blockchain.News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum projects launch MEV Blocker to reduce invisible tax, a problem worth $1.3 billion. 27 projects, including Balancer, Gnosis DAO, and Shapeshift, joined forces to create a free and censorship-resistant tool to counter MEV bots that inflate prices for users. MEV Blocker sends 90% of profits back to users and 10% to validators, giving power back to Ethereum users. This initiative comes as entrepreneurs try to reduce taxation on users, but the complexity of the Ethereum ecosystem means ongoing solutions are needed.

title: Ethereum Builders Join Forces to Launch MEV Blocker - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum developers have launched MEV Blocker, a tool that protects everyday users from Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) bots. The joint initiative by over 30 Ethereum projects routes transactions through a network of searchers to block front-running and sandwich attacks, and sends 90% of profits to users. MEV Blocker estimates that MEV bots have extracted over $1.38 billion from users, and the free service could potentially slow down transactions by 10%. The tool aims to protect users from front-running and sandwich attacks, and a validator has already successfully front-run MEV sandwich bots, earning $25 million in crypto.

title: Ethereum's Buterin and Solana's Yakovenko are at odds on security - crypto.news
summary: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin and Solana's Anatoly Yakovenko are debating the security of their respective blockchain bridges. Yakovenko proposed a trust-minimized bridge to address concerns of 51% attacks, but Buterin remains skeptical. The two are discussing the idea of a social layer to manage bridge management and ensure security.

title: What’s Governance Worth? Ethereum Scaling Tokens Say Billions - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: The article discusses the valuation of governance tokens for Ethereum scaling solutions, such as Arbitrum's ARB and Optimism's OP. These tokens are used for governance purposes, such as voting on the direction of the project. However, some investors are questioning whether the valuation of these tokens is justified, given that they only provide governance capabilities and have no other use cases. The article also mentions that there are potential airdrops of these tokens coming from major scaling solutions, which could increase competition among Layer 2s and pressure rollup teams to substantiate the value of their tokens. Additionally, the article notes that Tezos co-founder Arthur Brietman believes that rollup tokens shouldn't exist at all, while former partner at 1confirmation Kofi has developed a dashboard showing the scaling solutions as increasingly profitable since July.

title: Top Trader Predicts Massive Move for One Ethereum-Based Altcoin, Says One AI Token’s Chart Is ‘Crazy’ Bullish - The Daily Hodl
summary: Top trader predicts massive move for Ethereum-based altcoin, saying one AI token's chart is "crazy" bullish. The analyst, Bluntz, forecasts a 30% increase for blockchain indexing protocol The Graph (GRT) to $0.19, and a 50% surge for AI-focused project Fetch.ai (FET) to $0.55. The trader also weighs in on the upcoming Shanghai upgrade for Ethereum, which could trigger a run to the upside similar to Bitcoin's 2019 price action. Ethereum is currently trading at $1,912, up 2.5% in the past 24 hours.

title: Mutant Apes Take the Lead in Serum City, an ApeCoin-Powered Ethereum NFT Game - Decrypt
summary: Mutant Apes are taking center stage in Serum City, a new Ethereum-based NFT game that leverages ApeCoin as its primary in-game currency. Developed by Novel Labs in collaboration with Faraway, Serum City is a city-building game that allows players to create their own stories and game assets, and buy in-game currencies like gems using ApeCoin. The game is set in a dystopian world where Bored Apes are the ruling class and Mutant Apes are relegated to the fringes, and it explores the Mutant Cartel Expanded Universe and the characters Blaksoot and Darkfang. Serum City is designed to provide a richer and more appealing play experience, and its developers see it as a step towards interoperability with other Novel Labs games and beyond. The game will launch in August, and its assets will be NFTs that can be transferred and used in future Novel Labs games.

title: 3 Cryptos That Day Traders Love Right Now - Yahoo Finance

Ethereum is the second-largest crypto with a market cap of $224.5 billion and an average daily trading volume of $8.6 billion. These cryptos are highly liquid and have the potential for massive moves, making them attractive for day traders.

title: Shanghai (Shapella) ready - Coinbase
summary: Shanghai (Shapella) fork upgrade on April 12 will enable Ethereum validators to withdraw their staked ETH, which has been dormant since December 2020. The upgrade could lead to selling pressure, but our estimates suggest only around 1-2% of total daily ETH volumes could be sold. The impact of the upgrade will also depend on the trading environment and risk appetite, as well as the timeline for withdrawals from staking platforms like Lido and Binance. Additionally, the increase in base rewards on staked ETH could encourage more people to stake ETH, potentially growing the staking participation rate.

title: Why are stock market whales selling off and buying Ethereum (ETH) and RenQ Finance (RENQ)? - Analytics Insight
summary: Institutional investors are selling off their stocks and buying into cryptocurrencies like Ethereum (ETH) and RenQ Finance (RENQ) due to the pandemic's impact on the stock market. RenQ Finance offers advanced AI technology and interoperability across different blockchains, while Ethereum has recently upgraded its network for improved scalability and efficiency. The shift towards cryptocurrencies may signal a broader trend towards adopting crypto as a legitimate investment class, leading to increased demand and higher prices for cryptocurrencies.
